alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 4:07AM MDT until June 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An upper level trough approaching from the west will spread stronger west southwest winds over much of central and eastern New Mexico this afternoon. The combination of rising temperatures, very low humidity, strong winds, and an unstable airmass will produce critical fire weather conditions. Single-digit humidities will last 6 to 12 hours for portions of the Middle Rio Grande Valley. Another round of strong winds is expected to develop Friday afternoon ahead of an additional upper level disturbance. This will create the potential for additional critical fire weather, as dry and unstable conditions will persist on Friday. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Red Flag conditions today in the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and Central Highlands (Zone 125) from noon to 9 pm MDT. A Fire Weather Watch is also in effect for Friday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 to 40 mph each afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 5 to 12 percent each afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
